Name: Solar Resource Download

Caption.String: Visit the SAM website Weather Page for links to other data sources.

Description.String: Type or import a list of addresses or lat,lon in decimal degrees

Items.StringList: Default TMY file|Choose year|Download files for all years
Type an address or coordinates to download latest NSRDB data|Use Advanced NSRDB Options window to access all available data

in_location_options.Label: Download from a list of locations

in_nsrdb_options.Label: File options
in_nsrdb_options.IndexLabels: Default TMY file|Choose year|Download files for all years

is_advanced.Label: Advanced download option
is_advanced.IndexLabels: Type an address or coordinates to download latest NSRDB data|Use Advanced NSRDB Options window to access all available data

Callbacks: msgbox('Failed to open download log.\n' + log_file);

property( 'download_weather_caption' , 'Caption' , 'Click the Download button to choose files from a complete list of files available from the NSRDB, including TMY, TGY, TDY for different years and subhourly data.');

property( 'download_weather_caption' , 'Caption' , 'The NSRDB is a database of weather files that you can download and add to your to your solar resource library: Download a default typical-year (TMY) file for most long-term cash flow analyses, or choose files for single-year or P50/P90 analyses. See Help for details.' );
// check JSON returned by a call to NSRDB Data Query for a valid response
// json is valid if var is a table and var.errors is empty
msg += 'Message from NSRDB Data Query: ' + var.errors[0] + '.\nStatus = ' + var.status;
// if invalid key is supplied, API returns error with code and message
msg += 'NSRDB Data Query Error: ' + var.error.message + '.\nCode = ' + var.error.code;
if ( strpos( lower(var.code), 'api' ) > -1 ) { msg += 'See private.h to set API keys.'; }
// some locations are not covered by the NSRDB
// NSRDB API service could be down
msg += 'NSRDB Data Query did not return valid JSON string:\n\n';
// converts a file path to a key for the solar resource library
// clean up location string to use as file name
// remove  characters not allowed file names https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Filename
// this approach allows non-latin characters for international location names
// return a set of NSRDB urls for valid datasets available for a given lat/lon
// uses NSRDB Data Query on NREL Developer API
json_ok = false; // call to nsrdb API returned valid json with outputs
dataset_ok = false; // requested data is available from NSRDB API
msg += 'Latitude / longitude for NSRDB Data Query: ' + lat + ',' + lon +  '\n\n';
msg += 'URL for NSRDB Data Query: ' + url + '\n\n';
// store available names for troubleshooting message
// get index of dataset for requested file (tmy or single-year)
// this chooses the best available dataset and needs to be updated as NSRDB changes
// only use himawari-tmy if nsrdb-GOES-tmy-v4-0-0 is not available
// only use suny-india-tmy if himawari-tmy is not available
msg += 'No ' + str_tmy + ' file available for ' + lat + ', ' + lon + '. (Available datasets: ' + available_names + ')\n\n';
msg += 'Try the Advanced Download option or see https://sam.nrel.gov/weather for other sources of data.\n';
ok_test = ( lat != null && lon != null && dataset_ok == true );
return { 'name' = name , 'msg' = msg , 'url' = url, 'years' = years , 'ok' = ok_test };
file_skipped = false; // skip download if file exists
coordinate_list = []; // list of lat/lon values for locations
type = []; // store type output from API like "tmy" or year
pb = progressbar( { 'title' = 'Download Progress' , 'message' = 'Preparing download...' , 'cancelbutton' = true , 'closebutton' = true , 'time' = false , 'max' = 100 } );
str = replace( str, '\"', '' ); // files from spreadsheets may use quotes for strings
// geocode each location in the list of requested names
g = geocode( requested_name_list[i] ); // geocode function skips lat/lon locations
write_line( flog, '* Location \"' + requested_name_list[i] + '\" geocoded to ' + to_string([g.lat,g.lon]) );
progressbar( pb, {'message' = requested_name_list[i] + ' geocoded to ' + to_string([g.lat,g.lon]) , value = pb_count});
write_line( flog, '* Location \"' + requested_name_list[i] + '\" geocoding failed. Location skipped.');
progressbar( pb, {'message' = requested_name_list[i] + ' geocoding failed. Location skipped.', value = pb_count});
if ( value( 'in_time_step' ) == HOURLY || download_option == TMY ) { // tmy is always hourly
dataset[n] = nsrdb_query( lat, lon, download_option == TMY );
if ( download_option == TMY ) { // this needs to work for both nsrdb-GOES-tmy-v4-0-0 and suny-india-tmy
type = ['tmy']; // should get newest TMY file for nsrdb-GOES-tmy-v4-0-0, or tmy for suny-india-tmy
y = choose_from_list( dataset[n].years, 'Choose a year', 'Available Years for \"' + coordinate_list[n] +'\"', 0 );
write_line( flog, 'Year not valid: Selection cancelled by user.\n' );
// create folder for multiple years to facilitate
// p50 p90 and add to library folders list
// do not put tmy file in multiple year folder
// use default folder if mdkir() fails
// only get attributes SAM needs for simulations
// otherwise default is to get all attributes
url += '&wkt=POINT(' + lon + '%20' + lat + ')'; // note WKT is lon/lat, not lat/lon
// filename is requested location followed by lat/lon
fname = path + '/' + clean_name(requested_name_list[n]) + '_' + lat + '_' + lon + '_' + dataset[n].name + '_' + time_step + '_' + type[i] + '.csv';
if ( type[i] == 'tmy' ) { // for multiple year p50 p90 download
// check to see if file is already in library
write_line( flog, 'Download skipped, file already exists: ' + fname + '\n');
progressbar(pb, {'message' = 'Skipping ' + file_only(fname) + '. File already in library.', 'value' = pb_count });
// all is good so far, proceed with download
progressbar(pb, {'message' = 'Getting file(s) for ' + requested_name_list[n] + ' from ' + dataset[n].name + ' (' + type[i] + '). File ' + to_string(i+1) + ' of ' + #type + '.', 'value' = pb_count });
curl_ok = curl( url , { 'file'= fname } ); // curl() should replace <SAMAPI> from private.h and <USEREMAIL > from registry
write_line( flog, 'Failed to download file from NSRDB: cURL failed.');
progressbar(pb, {'message' = 'Failed to download weather file ' + fname, 'value' = pb_count });
if ( wf_error == 'no file name given to weather file reader' ){ // wfcheck may fail for filename with unicode characters, e.g., cyrillic
// remove location name with problematic characters from file name
fname_new = path + '/' + lat + '_' + lon + '_' + dataset[n].name + '_' + time_step + '_' + type[i] + '.csv';
if ( type[i] == 'tmy' ) { // for multiple year p50 p90 downloads
progressbar(pb, {'message' = 'Weather file renamed to \"' + file_only( fname ) +'\" due to invalid characters. See download log for details', 'value' = pb_count });
write_line( flog, 'Weather file renamed to remove invalid characters: Old name = ' + fname_old + ', new name = ' + fname_new + '.\n');
if ( download_ok == false) { // usually indicates NSRDB returned a file containing error message instead of weather data
progressbar(pb, {'message' = 'Weather file test failed for ' + file_only( fname ) +'. See download log for details', 'value' = pb_count });
write_line( flog, 'Weather file test failed, ' + wf_error + ': ' + fname + '.\n');
if ( #file_text < 1000 ) { // likely json or html with message from server
fname_new = replace( fname, '.csv' , '_bad.txt' ); // rename file so next download attempt won't detect existing file
write_line( flog, '* File renamed to: ' + fname_new + '.\n' );
write_line( flog, '* Failed to rename ' + fname + '.\n' );
// set library to last file that was downloaded and passed weather file test
write_line( flog, 'Weather file test passed: ' + fname + '.\n');
// downloads are finished, so finish reporting results
progressbar( pb, { 'message' = 'Download finished: File(s) already in library.', 'value' = 100 } );
progressbar( pb, { 'message' = 'Download finished: Failed for one or more locations.', 'value' = 100 } );
//show_log = yesno( 'Download Messages\nOpen log file to see messages?');
str += 'Do you want to show instructions for running ' + ? is_uncertainty_tech ['P50/P90', 'Uncertainty' ] + ' simulations now?';
+ '1. Click P50 / P90 at the bottom left of the main SAM window.\n\n'
+ '2. Click the ellipses (...) to the right of the Select Weather File Folder box.\n\n'
+ '\nIf you want to set a custom P value in addition to P10, P50 and P90, you can type a value for "Custom Px" before running the simulations.'
+ '\n\nTo remove this note window, delete all of its contents and close the window.';
+ '1. Click Uncertainty at the bottom left of the main SAM window.\n\n'
+ '2. Click the Choose Folder button to the right of the Select Weather File Folder box.\n\n'
+ '4. Click the Run Uncertainty Simulations button at the top of the page.\n'
+ '\nIf you want to set a custom P value, type a value for "Custom Px" before running the simulations.'
+ '\n\nTo remove this note window, delete all of its contents and close the window.';
progressbar( pb, { 'message' = 'Download complete! Solar resource library set to ' + file_only(fname), 'value' = 100 } );
